posts.post_content:
Man, this guy is going to be frustrating as hell for anyone who's trying to flip their [Garruk Relentless](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Garruk Relentless). I just have this image of him going out, choosing a target, meticulously tracking and stalking his prey, jumping down to fight it... and then he realizes at the last second that it's a [Spellskite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spellskite). For like the seventh time that day.  
  
Seems like that would be infuriating enough to just flip him to his cursed form regardless of his loyalty counters.

posts.post_content:
Since, for some reason, gatherer doesn't want to list the rulings, here are the pertinent bits about this card from the New Phyrexia FAQ:
  
   
•You can activate Spellskite's ability even if Spellskite wouldn't be a legal target for the spell or ability. However, the target of that spell or ability will remain unchanged.
  
   
•If changing one target of a spell or ability to Spellskite would make other targets of that spell or ability illegal, the targets remain unchanged.
  
   
•If the spell or ability has multiple instances of the word "target," you choose which target you're changing to Spellskite when Spellskite's ability resolves.
  
   
•By activating Spellskite's ability multiple times, you can change each target of a spell or ability with multiple instances of the word "target" to Spellskite, one at a time.
  
   
•The target of the spell or ability won't change unless Spellskite fulfills all the targeting criteria, even if multiple instances of the word "target" are used. For example, you can'... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Even if they get to chose what the Metamorph copies, this ability changes the target of the [Leonin Relic Warder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leonin Relic Warder) ability. This card itself is outstanding, and is often a behind the scenes key to victory to whoever gets it out.I'll give it a 5.

posts.post_content:
To Answer Philbo\_the\_Happy\_Halfling's Desire I did a bit of digging, and here was the best that I found. I also posted it on [Goblin Test Pilot](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Test Pilot)  
  
There is a way to INSTANTLY KILL an opponent with one of these. Practical? No, but neither is this.  
  
Equip Spellskite with [Darksteel Plate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darksteel Plate).  
Enchant Spellskite with [Druids Call](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Druids Call) and [Soul Link](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soul Link)  
You now have a spellskite that you can pay 2 life, redirect a [shock](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=shock) to, and you gain 2 life, and put two 1/1 squirrel tokens down.  
  
Add [Intruder Alarm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Intruder Alarm)  
Tap Goblin Test Pilot to deal 2 damage to a target something  
Pay 2 life, gain 2 life, put two tokens down, untap all creatures you control.   
Infinite Squirrel tokens(:  
  
Add pretty much any source of multi haste, or [Sanguine Bond](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sanguine Bond).
posts.html:
To Answer Philbo_the_Happy_Halfling's Desire I did a bit of digging, and here was the best that I found. I also posted it on Goblin Test Pilot

There is a way to INSTANTLY KILL an opponent with one of these. Practical? No, but neither is this.

Equip Spellskite with Darksteel Plate.
Enchant Spellskite with Druids Call and Soul Link
You now have a spellskite that you can pay 2 life, redirect a shock to, and you gain 2 life, and put two 1/1 squirrel tokens down.

Add Intruder Alarm
Tap Goblin Test Pilot to deal 2 damage to a target something
Pay 2 life, gain 2 life, put two tokens down, untap all creatures you control.
Infinite Squirrel tokens(:

Add pretty much any source of multi haste, or Sanguine Bond.

posts.post_content:
[pemmin's aura](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=pemmin's aura) does work, since you activate the shroud after redirecting the spell (causing it to fizzle). You can't redirect a second spell, however, and as others have pointed out [Neurok stealthsuit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Neurok stealthsuit) is a better choice to fizzle your opponents spells.  
  
This card is still very good though, it just might not be the prime target for pemmin's.
posts.html:
pemmin's aura does work, since you activate the shroud after redirecting the spell (causing it to fizzle). You can't redirect a second spell, however, and as others have pointed out Neurok stealthsuit is a better choice to fizzle your opponents spells.

This card is still very good though, it just might not be the prime target for pemmin's.
